intro: Gymnopsis verbesinoides, commonly known as the yellow sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in desert or semi-desert environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Gymnopsis verbesinoides is adapted to arid conditions and has a deep root system to access water from deeper soil layers.
